content: Road accidents have become more severe, two-wheelers continue to dominate as crime vehicles and victim vehicles.

title: Andhra Pradesh Government will ensure pensions for all eligible persons: Kondapalli Srinivas
content: Kondapalli Srinivas formally distributed monthly pensions to beneficiaries in K. Krishnapuram village of Dattirajeru mandal of Vizianagaram district

title: RCB says it’s working closely with BCCI, stadiums to design better crowd management
content: RCB announced a compensation of ₹25 lakh each to the eleven people who died in the stampede outside the M. Chinnaswamy Stadium on June 4

title: Nitish Katara murder case: Supreme Court extends interim bail of convict Vikas Yadav
content: Vikas Yadav is the son of Uttar Pradesh politician D P Yadav; his cousin Vishal Yadav was also punished for the kidnapping and murder of business executive Katara

title: Man electrocuted to death while adjusting Ganesh idol banner in Hyderabad
content: Bharat died instantly when a rod he extended came in contact with an 11 kV power line. He is survived by his wife and three children.

title: Allahabad High Court to hear Rahul Gandhi's petition on September 3
content: The Special Judge MP-MLA in Varanasi had remanded the matter to the ACJM court seeking registration of an FIR against Rahul Gandhi on his 2024 statement on Sikhs in America

title: Amoebic meningoencephalitis claims two more lives

title: SC upholds Telangana's domicile rules for admissions in medical colleges under State quota
content: The impugned rules entitled only those students who have studied for the last four years up to Class 12 in the State to get admission in the medical and dental colleges under the State quota.

title: Karnataka secures spot in National Quantum Mission Board
content: State Government designates Ekrup Caur, Secretary in the Department of Information Technology and Bio Technology (ITBT), as the nodal officer for the Hub Governing Board (HGB) of the National Quantum Mission (NQM)

title: Amit Shah speaks to Punjab Governor, CM; takes stock of flood situation

title: Commercial LPG prices slashed by ₹51.50 from September 1; no change in domestic cylinder rates
content: In Kolkata, Mumbai and Chennai, commercial LPG prices will be revised down to ₹1,684, ₹1,531.5, and ₹1,738, respectively, according to the Indian Oil Corporation

title: Chennai Corporation to purchase temple land for ₹18.85 crore to run a school after Madras High Court intervention
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh had fixed the consideration and persuaded the corporation as well as the temple to agree for a settlement in the interest of 2,500 students

title: PM Modi at SCO summit: ‘No double standards on terrorism will be acceptable’
content: PM Modi said India’s policy regarding the bloc was based on three pillars: security, connectivity, and opportunity.

title: India's MPL to sack 60% of local staff after paid gaming ban, source says

title: Maratha quota: Manoj Jarange vows to give up water as his protest enters fourth day

content: The state received 440.8 mm of rainfall against the season's average of 256.8 mm; the excess was more than 100% in five districts

content: Though Trump, with his laser focus on tariffs, has put almost every US relationship under strain, countries like Israel, China, and even Pakistan have weathered the storm. How?

title: "Humanity Wants An End To Russia-Ukraine Conflict," PM Modi Tells Putin In China
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi held bilateral talks with Russian President Vladimir Putin on the sidelines of the SCO summit in China on Monday. PM Modi told the Russian leader that humanity wants an end to the Russia-Ukraine conflict.

title: UPI Sees Record 20 Billion Transactions In August, Valued At Rs 24 Lakh Crore
content: In a significant development, the Unified Payments Interface (UPI) crossed 20 billion transactions in August for the first time in its history, the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) data showed on Monday.

title: US Man Takes Bereavement Leave, Then Kills Pregnant Girlfriend On Her Due Date
content: Prosecutors claimed that Kayvon Warren's motives for the alleged murder were driven by his relationship with another woman and financial struggles.

title: Bengaluru Man Chases Live-In-Partner's Car, Sets Her On Fire
content: The accused, Vital, a cab driver, had been married three times previously. Vanajakshi, too, had been married twice before entering a live-in relationship with him nearly four years ago.

title: PM Modi China Visit Live Updates: PM Modi, Putin Hold 45-Minute Meeting After SCO Summit
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday attended the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) summit in Tianjin, China, and called upon member countries to take firm and decisive action to fight terrorism.

title: Cyber Fraudster Poses As Police Chief, Tries To Scam Kerala Cops Using Fake WhatsApp Account
content: Police have launched an investigation after a cyber fraudster attempted to cheat cops in this south Kerala district by impersonating the district police chief and seeking money through a bogus WhatsApp account, a police official said on Monday.

title: They Fought For US In World War II. Today, China Calls Them Heroes
content: The shark's teeth painted on their planes were more of a threat than a decoration. In 1941, the Flying Tigers, Americans hired to fight in China, proved it in combat by shooting down hundreds of Japanese aircraft.

title: "One Who Can Fool Is The Best Leader": Nitin Gadkari In Nagpur
content: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari on Monday, while addressing a program addressed by the Akhil Bhartiya Mahanubhav Parishad, urged people to live with honesty and dedication.

title: Minutes Before PM-Putin Meet, US's "Defining Relationship" Signal To Delhi
content: A key member of US President Donald Trump's team has termed New Delhi-Washington DC ties a "defining relationship of the 21st century".

title: "Hope For Fair Elections In Myanmar": PM Modi To Junta Chief
content: India hopes that the forthcoming elections in Myanmar will be held in a fair and inclusive manner involving all stakeholders, Prime Minister Narendra Modi told the head of Myanmar's military junta, Senior General Min Aung Hlaing, on Sunday.

title: Indian Army Stops Infiltration Attempt By Terrorists In J&K's Poonch
content: The Indian Army troops on Monday scuttled an infiltration bid by terrorists along the Line of Control (LoC) in Mendhar Sector of Poonch district, officials said.

title: OpenAI Plans To Set Up Data Center In India: Report
content: ChatGPT parent OpenAI is scouting local partners to set up a data center in India with at least 1 gigawatt capacity, Bloomberg News reported on Monday, citing unidentified sources.

title: Over 600 Killed In 6.0 Earthquake In Afghanistan Near Pakistan Border
content: About 622 people were killed and more than 1,500 injured in an earthquake that struck eastern Afghanistan, authorities said on Monday, as helicopters ferried the wounded to safety from rubble being combed in the hunt for survivors.

title: 2 Pilgrims Killed, 3 Injured After Stone Falls On Vehicle In Uttarakhand's Rudraprayag
content: A landslide on the Kedarnath national highway left two people dead and six others injured on Monday, an official said.

title: Ex-New York Mayor Rudy Giuliani Injured In New Hampshire Car Crash
content: Rudy Giuliani is recovering from a fractured vertebra and other injuries following a car crash in New Hampshire in which he was a passenger, a spokesperson for the former New York City mayor said Sunday.

title: Explained: What North Korean Leader Kim Jong Un Wants From Rare China Trip
content: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un is set to visit China this week, a rare step beyond his country's borders, for prospective meetings with President Xi Jinping and his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin.

title: B-29 Superfortress: This WWII Bomber Was So Advanced It Cost More Than The Atomic Bomb
content: During World War II, Boeing B-29 was the most sophisticated bomber and also the most expensive weapon, costing more to design and build than the atomic bombs it dropped on Japan.

title: 250 Killed, Many Villages Destroyed As 6.0 Magnitude Earthquake Hits Afghanistan
content: A strong earthquake in eastern Afghanistan near the Pakistan border has killed at least 250 people and injured at least 500 others, officials said.

title: Start early, reach safely: Hyderabad police on Ganesh idol immersions

content: The invite is in appreciation of Andhra Pradesh’s leadership in the fields of human resources, technology, and economic development

title: Researchers identify new tuber species from Western Ghats in Kerala’s Wayanad district
content: The newly identified species has been named Dioscorea balakrishnanii after V. Balakrishnan, environmentalist and current secretary of the Kerala State Biodiversity Board

content: Project, which will offer an alternative to the Thamarassery Ghat road, expected to be completed in 60 months. The road connects Thiruvambady panchayat in Kozhikode district to Meppadi panchayat in Wayanad district

content: Claiming that the ‘Satya Yatra’ taken up by the Janata Dal (Secular) was meant to protect dharma and not politically motivated, JDS) youth wing leader Nikhil Kumaraswamy on Sunday said there has been a conspiracy against Dharmasthala, which has to be investigated by a Central agency

title: DKS hails Mysuru kings and Urs community for building ‘secular and irreligious’ Karnataka
content: Deputy Chief Minister D.K. Shivakumar on Sunday hailed the contribution of Mysuru kings and the Urs community towards building a secular and irreligious Karnataka with a focus on human development

content: Inter Miami forward Luis Suárez appeared to spit on a Seattle Sounders staffer after his team's 3-0 loss in the Leagues Cup final at Lumen Field on Sunday night.

title: 'Whatever it takes': Canes top Irish in showdown
content: Carter Davis made a 47-yard field goal, and No. 10 Miami came up with sacks on back-to-back plays to seal a win over No. 6 Notre Dame on Sunday night.

title: QB Prescott glad 'solution' reached with Parsons
content: Dak Prescott said while he didn't expect the Micah Parsons trade, he was glad a solution was reached ahead of the season opener.

title: Sources: Chiefs, McDuffie don't reach extension
content: The Chiefs and Trent McDuffie, their top cornerback, are not expected to agree to a multiyear contract extension before the start of the season.

title: Verlander earns win No. 265 with 121-pitch effort
content: Giants veteran Justin Verlander struck out 10 in five scoreless innings, throwing 121 pitches to earn the 265th win of his career.

title: Djokovic into record-extending 64th major quarter
content: Novak Djokovic dominated qualifier Jan-Lennard Struff 6-3, 6-3, 6-2 on Sunday night at the US Open to reach his record-extending 64th Grand Slam quarterfinal.

content: Chase Briscoe held off Tyler Reddick at Darlington Raceway on Sunday night and advanced to the second round of the NACAR Cup Series playoffs.

content: Fulham were furious when Josh King's goal was ruled out at Chelsea, while Manchester United's late victory over Burnley came courtesy of a VAR penalty.

content: Miranda Wang delivered clutch shots over the final three holes for a 2-under 70 and a one-shot victory over Jeeno Thitikul on Sunday in the FM Championship on Sunday.

title: WWE Clash in Paris results: Rollins keeps title, holds off Uso, Punk and Knight
content: Seth Rollins retained the World Heavyweight Championship against Jey Uso, CM Punk, and LA Knight, while John Cena beat Logan Paul at WWE Clash in Paris.

title: Norris' Dutch GP DNF makes the 2025 F1 title Piastri's to lose
content: Lando Norris' DNF at Sunday's Dutch GP may well be the decisive moment of the 2025 F1 season, when the title became Oscar Piastri's to lose.

title: Lee Corso's farewell to 'GameDay': Behind the scenes of a football celebration﻿
content: Fans, many without tickets to the game, came from all over the country to Columbus to get a glimpse of Corso one last time.

title: From Collier to Clark and more: How injury returns could impact the playoffs
content: Napheesa Collier and Breanna Stewart are back, with more injured stars eyeing returns before the postseason.

title: NBA predictions: 10 teams that could exceed, fall short of ESPN's forecast
content: Too low on OKC? Too high on the Spurs? Tim Bontemps breaks down ESPN's Summer Forecast win predictions.

title: FSU's Tommy Castellanos trolls Alabama, sells 'Nick Can't Save Them' shirts
content: Castellanos made headlines after saying the legendary coach couldn't save the Tide from their matchup.

title: 'The Rich Eisen Show' on ESPN: How to listen and watch
content: 'The Rich Eisen Show' is joining forces with ESPN platforms! Find out how to get your weekday dose of pop culture and sports now.

title: Watch: Afghanistan quake flattens villages, over 800 dead; buildings reduced to rubble
content: A devastating magnitude 6 earthquake struck eastern Afghanistan near the Pakistan border on Sunday, resulting in a tragic loss of over 800 lives and leaving approximately 1300 individuals injured. The powerful tremors caused widespread destruction, leveling numerous villages and buildings in the affected region. Rescue operations are currently underway, with medical teams dispatched from neighboring provinces and Kabul to provide assistance.

title: Bengaluru man chases live-in partner’s car, douses her in petrol; sets her ablaze
content: In Bengaluru, a 35-year-old woman, Vanajakshi, tragically died after her live-in partner, Vithal, allegedly set her on fire following a history of domestic disputes. Vithal, a cab driver, was arrested after he intercepted a car Vanajakshi was traveling in, pouring petrol on her and the other occupants at a traffic signal.

title: SCO member states condemn Pahalgam attack in Tianjin declaration; express condolences
content: The Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) strongly condemned the terrorist attack in Pahalgam on April 22, 2025, expressing condolences to the victims' families. The SCO reaffirmed its commitment to fighting terrorism, separatism, and extremism, emphasizing that perpetrators must face justice. Following the attack that killed 26, India launched Operation Sindoor, targeting terror hideouts across the border.

title: AI restructure at Meta: Alexandr Wang’s memo to staff; one thing is clear—All report to him
content: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg is intensifying the AI race by reorganizing Meta Superintelligence Labs (MSL) into four specialized teams under Alexandr Wang's leadership. This restructuring aims to accelerate the pursuit of "personal superintelligence," consolidating research, product development, and infrastructure efforts. Key leaders like Nat Friedman and Aparna Ramani will play crucial roles in this ambitious endeavor.

title: IPL Slapgate: Match referee breaks silence; calls Harbhajan a good friend
content: Farokh Engineer, the match referee during the infamous 'Slapgate' incident in the 2008 IPL, expressed surprise at the recent release of the footage. He emphasized maintaining confidentiality and believes the matter should remain in the past, as both Harbhajan Singh and S. Sreesanth have likely moved on. The resurfacing of the clip has stirred reactions, with Sreesanth's wife expressing disappointment and anger.

title: Afghanistan earthquake: Over 800 killed, thousands injured
content: A devastating 6.0-magnitude earthquake struck Afghanistan's Kunar province, resulting in at least 250 fatalities and over 500 injuries. The midnight quake, followed by aftershocks, toppled homes along the Pakistan border. Rescue operations are underway in remote districts, with the toll expected to rise due to difficult access and fragile housing in the region.

title: 'Brahmins profiteering': Trump aide's latest jibe at India over Russian oil
content: Peter Navarro accused India of indirectly funding Russia's war in Ukraine through discounted oil purchases, alleging that Brahmins are profiting at the expense of the Indian people. He criticized India's high tariffs, claiming they hurt American workers and taxpayers while indirectly funding the Russian war machine. Navarro also expressed optimism about trade negotiations with China.

title: AI talks: Google chief scientist on topics he avoids; ‘People have very different definitions’
content: Google's Chief Scientist Jeff Dean avoids discussing Artificial General Intelligence (AGI) due to its varying definitions. He believes current AI models already surpass average human capabilities in many non-physical tasks. Dean anticipates automated search and computation will accelerate scientific and engineering progress, augmenting human abilities within the next two decades.

title: Over 300 dead in Himachal as heavy rains trigger landslides, floods
content: Himachal Pradesh has been devastated by relentless monsoon rains since June 20, resulting in over 300 deaths and widespread destruction. Landslides, flash floods, and road blockages have crippled the state, severely impacting agriculture and pilgrimage routes. Authorities are focused on relief efforts as more heavy rainfall is expected, with schools closed and warnings issued.

title: Silver price today: Silver hits record high; crosses Rs 1.24 lakh mark
content: Silver price today: Silver prices experienced a significant surge, climbing by Rs 2,597 to exceed Rs 1.24 lakh per kilogram in futures trading, mirroring strong global market performance. This surge was fueled by factors such as increased US tariffs on Indian products, a weakening rupee, and investors seeking safe-haven assets.

title: 'Stigma of rape on perpetrator, not survivor': Delhi HC chides rape accused
content: The Delhi High Court reprimanded an accused, imposing a ₹10,000 penalty for suggesting that dropping a rape case would protect the minor survivor from stigma.

title: Visa update in India: US embassy to applicants; From August, this passport service ends
content: Important update for US visa applicants. Starting August 1, 2025, the United States will stop third-party passport collection. Applicants can collect passports in person or opt for home delivery at Rs 1,200. For applicants under 18, a parent or guardian must collect the passport with a consent letter.

title: Pakistan: Helicopter crashes in Diamer, at least five killed
content: A Pakistan government helicopter crashed in the Gilgit-Baltistan region during a test landing, resulting in the deaths of five people, including two pilots and three technicians. Initial reports suggest a technical fault caused the crash, leading to a fire. This incident follows similar helicopter crashes in recent months, raising concerns about aviation safety in the region.

title: Russia-India-China troika on display at SCO; PM Modi, Putin, Xi share warm moments
content: Prime Minister Modi, Russian President Putin, and Chinese President Xi Jinping displayed camaraderie at the SCO Summit 2025 in Tianjin, exchanging handshakes and hugs. Modi shared pictures of the interactions on X, emphasizing the importance of exchanging perspectives. Xi Jinping, in his banquet address, called for unity among SCO members to safeguard regional peace amid global uncertainties.

title: ‘Dark and fat’ taunts: Rajasthan man gets death for burning wife alive
content: In a shocking verdict, a Udaipur court sentenced Kishandas to death for the gruesome murder of his wife, Laxmi, in 2017. Kishandas, driven by disdain for Laxmi's appearance, tricked her into applying a flammable chemical before setting her ablaze. The court deemed the crime exceptionally heinous, warranting capital punishment to deter similar acts.

title: Career advice in tech era: Google cofounder to youngsters; embrace tech to be ‘more lazy’
content: Larry Page advised University of Michigan graduates in 2009 to leverage technology for efficiency, citing Google's scalable impact as an example. He emphasized that a small team can create software used by millions, contrasting it with the limitations of manual labor. Page's philosophy propelled Google from a startup to a $2.3 trillion tech giant.

title: Boys vs girls: NSS 2025 survey compares education spend
content: The National Statistics Office (NSO) has released findings from the Comprehensive Modular Survey: Education (CMS:E) 2025, highlighting gender-wise differences in education expenditure across India. The survey shows that boys' education expenses are consistently higher than girls' in both rural and urban areas, covering government and private schools. Spending on tuition fees, uniforms, transport, textbooks, and private coaching was examined, with urban averages significantly higher. The report provides detailed comparisons by level of enrolment and type of school.

title: Chargers vs Chiefs YouTube coverage: ESPN bans Jason Kelce
content: YouTube's pursuit of Jason Kelce for its exclusive Chargers-Chiefs broadcast in Brazil was thwarted by ESPN. Kelce, now an ESPN analyst, is restricted from appearing on competitor platforms like YouTube due to a new company policy. This decision marks a shift from last season, as ESPN tightens control over its on-air talent amid the rise of streaming in live sports.

title: Gold price prediction: What's the outlook this week - should you buy or sell?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold and silver prices are surging to new heights, fueled by expectations of a US Federal Reserve rate cut, geopolitical tensions, and a weaker rupee. Market volatility is anticipated this week due to a US holiday and upcoming economic data releases, including US jobs market figures and PMI numbers from major economies.

title: 'No double standards on terror': PM Modi's stern message to Pak at SCO; Sharif present
content: Addressing the SCO Summit in Tianjin, PM Modi urged a united global front against terrorism, emphasizing that no double standards are acceptable. He highlighted India's experience with terrorism and the need for consistent opposition to it.

title: Bengaluru shocker: Employee slips on shoe; hidden viper bites leading to death
content: In Bengaluru, a 41-year-old man, Manju Prakash, tragically died after a snake bit him in his shoe. The incident occurred at his residence in Ranganatha Layout, Bannerghatta. Manju, unaware of the snake, wore the shoe and went to bed, and was later found unresponsive.

title: India’s mfg PMI hits 17.5-year high; output rate expansion fastest in nearly 5 yrs
content: India's manufacturing sector experienced substantial growth in August, with the PMI reaching a 17.5-year high of 59.3. This surge was fueled by heightened production volumes, driven by improved supply-demand coordination and robust domestic demand.

title: Watch: PM Modi, Putin walk past Pak PM at SCO Summit; Shehbaz Sharif left looking on
content: During the SCO Summit in Tianjin, PM Modi and President Putin displayed camaraderie, while PM Modi and President Xi discussed border peace and resuming flights. India's S-400 missile defense system, dubbed "Sudarshan Chakra," played a crucial role in Operation Sindoor, successfully intercepting Pakistani drones and missiles aimed at Indian cities, bolstering India's air defense capabilities.

title: US Open: Polish millionaire defends cap-snatch moment with young fan; warns legal action
content: Piotr Szczerek, a millionaire businessman, faces backlash after taking a signed cap from a child at the US Open. The incident sparked outrage. Szczerek defended his actions, further fueling criticism. Online users called for boycotts of his company, Drogbruk. Tennis player Kamil Majchrzak gifted the boy a new cap. The millionaire has warned legal action against those abusing him online.

title: 'Bumrah is world class, credit to India for managing his workload': Wasim Akram
content: Wasim Akram hailed Jasprit Bumrah as a “modern-day great,” praising India for expertly managing his workload. While refusing to compare eras, Akram highlighted the increased challenges bowlers face in modern cricket due to aggressive batting. He also opposed the two-tier WTC system, stressing the need for quality teams and stronger domestic structures before introducing more nations to Test cricket.

title: 'Third World Nation' fear: Trump warns of fallout if tariffs struck down
content: Donald Trump warned that the US would become a "Third World Nation" if courts struck down his tariffs. He defended them, claiming over $15 trillion would be invested in the US due to these tariffs, calling it a record. Trump emphasized that tariffs are strengthening the economy, leading to lower prices and virtually no inflation.

title: SCO Summit: Xi slams 'bullying behaviour'; urges to oppose 'Cold War mentality'
content: At the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit in Tianjin, Chinese President Xi Jinping criticized what he termed the "bullying behaviour" in the world order. He urged Russia and India to resist a "Cold War mentality." Prime Minister Narendra Modi also participated in the summit, which focused on charting the SCO's future.

title: Aaradhya Bachchan's resemblance to her mother in unseen teenage photos will leave you amazed
content: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Aaradhya Bachchan recently visited a Ganeshotsav pandal, captivating onlookers. Aaradhya's appearance, sporting an orange ensemble and wavy hair, sparked comparisons to a rare, unseen teenage photo of Aishwarya. The uncanny resemblance between mother and daughter, from facial features to their smiles, has ignited online buzz, with many noting Aaradhya is her mother's mirror image.

title: Kalkaji Temple sewadar beaten to death: Attackers and victim had history of run-ins
content: Tensions over darshan and prasad distribution at Delhi's Kalkaji Temple appear to be the motive behind the murder of Yogendra Singh. Previous confrontations between the victim and the accused escalated into a fatal attack. Police have arrested five individuals, including the father of one attacker who allegedly provided shelter, and are searching for two more suspects.

title: Ishita Mallik murder: How killer fled West Bengal with uncle’s help
content: Krishnanagar Police apprehended Kuldeep Singh, uncle of Deshraj Singh, from Gujarat's Jamnagar for allegedly tampering with evidence in the Ishita Mallik murder case. Kuldeep is accused of helping Deshraj, who fatally shot Mallik, flee after the incident. Police suspect Kuldeep knows Deshraj's whereabouts and that the firearm was sourced from Uttar Pradesh.

title: US Labor Day: Are banks, stock markets and stores open or closed on September 1? Check full list
content: Labor Day, celebrated on the first Monday of September, honors American workers and their contributions to the US economy. Many banks, government offices, and the stock market will be closed. While some retail stores like Costco will be closed, others such as Walmart and Trader Joe's will remain open, with pharmacy hours varying by location.

title: Ghaziabad: 30 vehicles break down after refueling at Morta pump
content: Around 30 vehicle owners in Ghaziabad have filed a police complaint, alleging that their cars broke down shortly after refueling at a Bajaj HP station in Morta between August 26 and 29. Customers suspect adulterated diesel caused engine problems, potentially leading to repair costs as high as Rs 3.5 lakh per vehicle.

title: Why is Agra’s Rs 500 crore petha industry facing existential crisis?
content: Agra's famed petha industry faces an uncertain future as a Supreme Court directive orders relocation of manufacturing units within the Taj Trapezium Zone to protect the Taj Mahal from pollution. This move threatens the livelihoods of nearly 5,000 people involved in the trade, who fear the financial burden of restarting elsewhere.

title: Bengaluru sexual assault: Knife-wielding intruder harasses PG girl, escapes with cash
content: In Bengaluru's BTM Layout, a 21-year-old woman was sexually harassed and robbed in her PG accommodation. An intruder entered her room early in the morning, assaulted her, and stole Rs 2,500. Despite her efforts to stop him, he escaped, and police are investigating the incident, which occurred at Laxmana Durga Ladies PG. The security guard was asleep during the incident.

title: Mumbai gridlock: Protesters camp, cook, urinate on streets; BMC scales up services
content: Protests in Mumbai's CSMT area severely impacted weekend sales around Crawford Market as festival shoppers stayed away due to safety concerns. The large crowds, numbering around 30,000, overwhelmed the BMC, leading to sanitation issues and strained resources.

title: Who is Devki Devi? ‘Solar Didi’ wins PM’s praise; lighting up rural lives with dignity
content: Devki Devi, a resident of Muzaffarpur, Bihar, has become an inspiration for women empowerment. Referred to as "Solar Didi" by PM Modi, she overcame financial struggles by embracing solar energy for irrigation. With support from the JEEViKA self-help group, she secured a loan to install solar panels, irrigating over 40 acres for 112 farmers.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens above 24,500; Sensex up over 300 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Monday. While Nifty50 was above 24,500, BSE Sensex was up over 300 points.

title: E20 ethanol-blended petrol hits vehicle mileage, users bear brunt
content: Consumers are facing a double whammy as E20 petrol, while promoted for environmental benefits, leads to a 2-6% drop in vehicle mileage. Despite paying high fuel prices, users report reduced efficiency, prompting questions about the financial burden. A Niti Aayog report suggested lower retail prices for blended fuels to offset the efficiency loss, though ARAI studies claim no adverse impact.

title: 6.0 magnitude earthquake rocks Afghanistan: At least 20 killed; tremors felt in Pakistan
content: A 6.0-magnitude earthquake struck eastern Afghanistan near the Pakistan border, resulting in over 20 fatalities. More than 115 injured individuals have been hospitalized in Nangarhar and Kunar provinces. The shallow quake, followed by aftershocks, shook buildings across the region, with tremors felt as far as Islamabad. The incident occurred shortly after Nangarhar province experienced devastating floods, compounding the region's challenges.

title: ‘2-system interaction’ may trigger heavy rains in Uttarakhand, Himachal and J&K
content: North India's hill states brace for another intense spell of heavy rainfall as the IMD forecasts a convergence of the monsoon trough and an active western disturbance. Uttarakhand, Himachal Pradesh, and Jammu & Kashmir are at high risk of flash floods and landslides.

title: Priya Marathe’s sudden demise at 38: Who is her husband Shantanu Moghe?
content: Actress Priya Marathe, known for her roles in Pavitra Rishta and Kasamh Se, sadly passed away at 38 after battling cancer. Her last social media post, featuring her husband Shantanu Moghe at Amer Fort, has become a poignant memory for fans.

title: Rinku Singh Exclusive: 'Don't like being tagged as T20I specialist'
content: Rinku Singh, known for his T20 heroics, asserts his capabilities extend to red-ball cricket, aiming to represent India in Tests. Preparing for the Asia Cup 2025, he emphasizes evolving his technique with guidance from Abhishek Nair and Gautam Gambhir. Singh aspires to contribute across all formats, driven by self-belief and a desire to win the T20 World Cup.

title: 'Country would be completely destroyed': Trump defends tariffs after US court setback
content: Donald Trump defended his trade policy after a court declared most of his tariffs illegal. He thanked a judge who sided with him. Trump claimed tariffs brought trillions of dollars to the US. A court ruled Trump overstepped his authority with the tariffs. The levies were set to cover about 69 percent of US imports.
